conclusion: Initial setup of the problem with cylinder, piston, and elevator details.
Understanding forces when the elevator is stationary.
Cylinder suspended by rope with piston inside.
Net force on the cylinder is zero when stationary.
Tension in rope equals weight of cylinder plus atmospheric pressure minus gas pressure.
Net force on piston is zero when stationary.
Pressure inside cylinder equals atmospheric pressure plus piston weight per area.
Re-evaluation of piston equilibrium with correct pressure calculation.
Re-evaluation of cylinder equilibrium with correct tension calculation.
Calculation of tension in rope when stationary.
Comparison of calculated tension with maximum tension the rope can withstand.
Consideration of changes when elevator moves.
